newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: CRICKET-RAIN DELAYS NEW ZEALAND-ENGLAND ONE-DAYER.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-RAIN DELAYS NEW ZEALAND-ENGLAND ONE-DAYER.

text.p: Rain again delayed the start of play in the fourth one-day cricket international between England and New Zealand at Eden Park on Sunday.
The match was scheduled to be played on Saturday but persistent rain caused it to be postponed until Sunday, the reserve day.
The weather in Auckland on Sunday morning was misty, with low cloud cover and drizzle preventing a start on time at 10.30 a.m. (2130 GMT).
However, match officials said they were hopeful of starting at about midday (2300 GMT), with the number of overs reduced to 44 per side.
England hold a 2-0 lead in the series after winning the first and second matches. The third game, in Napier last Wednesday, ended in a tie.
If no play is possible on Sunday, the match will be abandoned and England win the series.
